metadata.title: DSA-3441-1 -- perl -- security update
metadata.description: David Golden of MongoDB discovered that File::Spec::canonpath() in Perl returned untainted strings even if passed tainted input. This defect undermines taint propagation, which is sometimes used to ensure that unvalidated user input does not reach sensitive code.

metadata.title: DSA-3413-1 -- openssl -- security update
metadata.description: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in OpenSSL, a Secure Sockets Layer toolkit.

metadata.title: DSA-3414-1 -- xen -- security update
metadata.description: Multiple security issues have been found in the Xen virtualisation solution, which may result in denial of service or information disclosure.

metadata.title: DSA-3415-1 -- chromium-browser -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities have been discovered in the chromium web browser.

metadata.title: DSA-3426-1 -- linux -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities have been discovered in the Linux kernel that may lead to a privilege escalation, denial of service, information leak or data loss.

metadata.title: DSA-3423-1 -- cacti -- security update
metadata.description: Several SQL injection vulnerabilities have been discovered in Cacti, an RRDTool frontend written in PHP. Specially crafted input can be used by an attacker in the rra_id value of the graph.php script to execute arbitrary SQL commands on the database.

metadata.title: DSA-3439-1 -- prosody -- security update
metadata.description: Two vulnerabilities were discovered in Prosody, a lightweight Jabber/XMPP server.

metadata.title: DSA-3443-1 -- libpng -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities have been discovered in the libpng PNG library.

metadata.title: DSA-3411-1 -- cups-filters -- security update
metadata.description: Michal Kowalczyk discovered that missing input sanitising in the foomatic-rip print filter might result in the execution of arbitrary commands.

metadata.title: DSA-3429-1 -- foomatic-filters -- security update
metadata.description: Michal Kowalczyk and Adam Chester discovered that missing input sanitising in the foomatic-rip print filter might result in the execution of arbitrary commands.

metadata.title: DSA-3433-1 -- samba -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities have been discovered in Samba, a SMB/CIFS file, print, and login server for Unix.

metadata.title: DSA-3412-1 -- redis -- security update
metadata.description: Luca Bruno discovered an integer overflow flaw leading to a stack-based buffer overflow in redis, a persistent key-value database. A remote attacker can use this flaw to cause a denial of service (application crash).

metadata.title: DSA-3430-1 -- libxml2 -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities were discovered in libxml2, a library providing support to read, modify and write XML and HTML files. A remote attacker could provide a specially crafted XML or HTML file that, when processed by an application using libxml2, would cause that application to use an excessive amount of CPU, leak potentially sensitive information, or crash the application.

metadata.title: DSA-3427-1 -- blueman -- security update
metadata.description: It was discovered that the Mechanism plugin of Blueman, a graphical Bluetooth manager, allows local privilege escalation.

metadata.title: DSA-3410-1 -- icedove -- security update
metadata.description: Multiple security issues have been found in Icedove, Debian's version of the Mozilla Thunderbird mail client: Multiple memory safety errors, integer overflows, buffer overflows and other implementation errors may lead to the execution of arbitrary code or denial of service.

metadata.title: DSA-3417-1 -- bouncycastle -- security update
metadata.description: Tibor Jager, Jörg Schwenk, and Juraj Somorovsky, from Horst Görtz Institute for IT Security, published a paper in ESORICS 2015 where they describe an invalid curve attack in Bouncy Castle Crypto, a Java library for cryptography. An attacker is able to recover private Elliptic Curve keys from different applications, for example, TLS servers.

metadata.title: DSA-3422-1 -- iceweasel -- security update
metadata.description: Multiple security issues have been found in Iceweasel, Debian's version of the Mozilla Firefox web browser: Multiple memory safety errors, integer overflows, use-after-frees and other implementation errors may lead to the execution of arbitrary code, bypass of the same-origin policy or denial of service.

metadata.title: DSA-3420-1 -- bind9 -- security update
metadata.description: It was discovered that the BIND DNS server does not properly handle the parsing of incoming responses, allowing some records with an incorrect class to be accepted by BIND instead of being rejected as malformed. This can trigger a REQUIRE assertion failure when those records are subsequently cached. A remote attacker can exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service against servers performing recursive queries.

metadata.title: DSA-3442-1 -- isc-dhcp -- security update
metadata.description: It was discovered that a maliciously crafted packet can crash any of the isc-dhcp applications. This includes the DHCP client, relay, and server application. Only IPv4 setups are affected.

metadata.title: DSA-3438-1 -- xscreensaver -- security update
metadata.description: It was discovered that unplugging one of the monitors in a multi-monitor setup can cause xscreensaver to crash. Someone with physical access to a machine could use this problem to bypass a locked session.

metadata.title: DSA-3440-1 -- sudo -- security update
metadata.description: When sudo is configured to allow a user to edit files under a directory that they can already write to without using sudo, they can actually edit (read and write) arbitrary files. Daniel Svartman reported that a configuration like this might be introduced unintentionally if the editable files are specified using wildcards, for example.

metadata.title: DSA-3424-1 -- subversion -- security update
metadata.description: Ivan Zhakov discovered an integer overflow in mod_dav_svn, which allows an attacker with write access to the server to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service.

metadata.title: DSA-3419-1 -- cups-filters -- security update
metadata.description: Adam Chester discovered that missing input sanitising in the foomatic-rip print filter might result in the execution of arbitrary commands.

metadata.title: DSA-3409-1 -- putty -- security update
metadata.description: A memory-corrupting integer overflow in the handling of the ECH (erase characters) control sequence was discovered in PuTTY's terminal emulator. A remote attacker can take advantage of this flaw to mount a denial of service or potentially to execute arbitrary code.

metadata.title: DSA-3431-1 -- ganeti -- security update
metadata.description: Pierre Kim discovered two vulnerabilities in the restful API of Ganeti, a virtual server cluster management tool. SSL parameter negotiation could result in denial of service and the DRBD secret could leak.

metadata.title: DSA-3432-1 -- icedove -- security update
metadata.description: Multiple security issues have been found in Icedove, Debian's version of the Mozilla Thunderbird mail client: Multiple memory safety errors, integer overflows, buffer overflows and other implementation errors may lead to the execution of arbitrary code or denial of service.

metadata.title: DSA-3435-1 -- git -- security update
metadata.description: Blake Burkhart discovered that the Git git-remote-ext helper incorrectly handled recursive clones of git repositories. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to execute arbitary code by injecting commands via crafted URLs.

metadata.title: DSA-3425-1 -- tryton-server -- security update
metadata.description: Cédric Krier discovered a vulnerability in the server-side of Tryton, an application framework written in Python. An authenticated malicious user can write arbitrary values in record fields due missed checks of access permissions when multiple records are written.

metadata.title: DSA-3416-1 -- libphp-phpmailer -- security update
metadata.description: Takeshi Terada discovered a vulnerability in PHPMailer, a PHP library for email transfer, used by many CMSs. The library accepted email addresses and SMTP commands containing line breaks, which can be abused by an attacker to inject messages.

metadata.title: DSA-3418-1 -- chromium-browser -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities have been discovered in the chromium web browser.

metadata.title: DSA-3408-1 -- gnutls26 -- security update
metadata.description: It was discovered that GnuTLS, a library implementing the TLS and SSL protocols, incorrectly validates the first byte of padding in CBC modes. A remote attacker can possibly take advantage of this flaw to perform a padding oracle attack.

metadata.title: DSA-3437-1 -- gnutls26 -- security update
metadata.description: Karthikeyan Bhargavan and Gaetan Leurent at INRIA discovered a flaw in the TLS 1.2 protocol which could allow the MD5 hash function to be used for signing ServerKeyExchange and Client Authentication packets during a TLS handshake. A man-in-the-middle attacker could exploit this flaw to conduct collision attacks to impersonate a TLS server or an authenticated TLS client.

metadata.title: DSA-3444-1 -- wordpress -- security update
metadata.description: Crtc4L discovered a cross-site scripting vulnerability in wordpress, a web blogging tool, allowing a remote authenticated administrator to compromise the site.

metadata.title: DSA-3421-1 -- grub2 -- security update
metadata.description: Hector Marco and Ismael Ripoll, from Cybersecurity UPV Research Group, found an integer underflow vulnerability in Grub2, a popular bootloader. A local attacker can bypass the Grub2 authentication by inserting a crafted input as username or password.

metadata.title: DSA-3434-1 -- linux -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities have been discovered in the Linux kernel that may lead to a privilege escalation, denial of service or information leak.

metadata.title: DSA-3436-1 -- openssl -- security update
metadata.description: Karthikeyan Bhargavan and Gaetan Leurent at INRIA discovered a flaw in the TLS 1.2 protocol which could allow the MD5 hash function to be used for signing ServerKeyExchange and Client Authentication packets during a TLS handshake. A man-in-the-middle attacker could exploit this flaw to conduct collision attacks to impersonate a TLS server or an authenticated TLS client.

metadata.title: DSA-3428-1 -- tomcat8 -- security update
metadata.description: It was discovered that malicious web applications could use the Expression Language to bypass protections of a Security Manager as expressions were evaluated within a privileged code section.

metadata.title: DSA-3445-1 -- pygments -- security update
metadata.description: Javantea discovered that pygments, a generic syntax highlighter, is prone to a shell injection vulnerability allowing a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code via shell metacharacters in a font name.

metadata.title: EOL: DSA-3314-1 typo3-src -- end of life
metadata.description: Upstream security support for Typo3 4.5.x ended three months ago and the same now applies to the Debian packages as well. Newer versions of Typo3 are no longer packaged in Debian, so the recommended alternative is to migrate to a custom installation of Typo3 6.2.x (the current long term branch)..

metadata.title: Debian GNU/Linux 2.2 is installed
metadata.description: Debian GNU/Linux 2.2 (potato) is installed

metadata.title: Debian GNU/Linux 3.0 is installed
metadata.description: Debian GNU/Linux 3.0 (woody) is installed

metadata.title: Ubuntu 4.10 is installed
metadata.description: Ubuntu 4.10 is installed

metadata.title: Ubuntu 5.10 is installed
metadata.description: Ubuntu 5.10 is installed

metadata.title: Ubuntu 5.04 is installed
metadata.description: Ubuntu 5.04 is installed

metadata.title: Ubuntu 16.04 LTS is installed
metadata.description: Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (Xenial Xerus) is installed

metadata.title: DSA-3516-1 -- wireshark -- security update
metadata.description: Multiple vulnerabilities were discovered in the dissectors/parsers for DNP, RSL, LLRP, GSM A-bis OML, ASN 1 BER which could result in denial of service.

metadata.title: DSA-3538-1 -- libebml -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities were discovered in libebml, a library for manipulating Extensible Binary Meta Language files.

metadata.title: DSA-3550-1 -- openssh -- security update
metadata.description: Shayan Sadigh discovered a vulnerability in OpenSSH: If PAM support is enabled and the sshd PAM configuration is configured to read userspecified environment variables and the <q>UseLogin</q> option is enabled, a local user may escalate her privileges to root.

metadata.title: DSA-3542-1 -- mercurial -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities have been discovered in Mercurial, a distributed version control system.

metadata.title: DSA-3505-1 -- wireshark -- security update
metadata.description: Multiple vulnerabilities were discovered in the dissectors/parsers for Pcapng, NBAP, UMTS FP, DCOM, AllJoyn, T.38, SDP, NLM, DNS, BED, SCTP, 802.11, DIAMETER, VeriWave, RVSP, ANSi A, GSM A, Ascend, NBAP, ZigBee ZCL and Sniffer which could result in denial of service.

metadata.title: DSA-3508-1 -- jasper -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities were discovered in JasPer, a library for manipulating JPEG-2000 files.

metadata.title: DSA-3535-1 -- kamailio -- security update
metadata.description: Stelios Tsampas discovered a buffer overflow in the Kamailio SIP proxy which might result in the execution of arbitrary code.

metadata.title: DSA-3567-1 -- libpam-sshauth -- security update
metadata.description: It was discovered that libpam-sshauth, a PAM module to authenticate using an SSH server, does not correctly handle system users. In certain configurations an attacker can take advantage of this flaw to gain root privileges.

metadata.title: DSA-3529-1 -- redmine -- security update
metadata.description: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in Redmine, a project management web application, which may result in information disclosure.

metadata.title: DSA-3537-1 -- imlib2 -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities were discovered in imlib2, an image manipulation library.

metadata.title: DSA-3518-1 -- spip -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities were found in SPIP, a website engine for publishing, resulting in code injection.

metadata.title: DSA-358-4 -- linux-kernel-2.4.18 -- several vulnerabilities
metadata.description: A number of vulnerabilities have been discovered in the Linux kernel.

metadata.title: DSA-3541-1 -- roundcube -- security update
metadata.description: High-Tech Bridge Security Research Lab discovered that Roundcube, a webmail client, contained a path traversal vulnerability. This flaw could be exploited by an attacker to access sensitive files on the server, or even execute arbitrary code.

metadata.title: DSA-3519-1 -- xen -- security update
metadata.description: Multiple security issues have been found in the Xen virtualisation solution, which may result in denial of service or information disclosure.

metadata.title: DSA-355-1 -- gallery -- cross-site scripting
metadata.description: Larry Nguyen discovered a cross site scripting vulnerability in gallery, a web-based photo album written in php. This security flaw can allow a malicious user to craft a URL that executes Javascript code on your website.

metadata.title: DSA-3514-1 -- samba -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities have been discovered in Samba, a SMB/CIFS file, print, and login server for Unix.

metadata.title: DSA-3506-1 -- libav -- security update
metadata.description: Several security issues have been corrected in multiple demuxers and decoders of the libav multimedia library.

metadata.title: DSA-3566-1 -- openssl -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities were discovered in OpenSSL, a Secure Socket Layer toolkit.

metadata.title: DSA-3569-1 -- openafs -- security update
metadata.description: Two vulnerabilities were discovered in openafs, an implementation of the distributed filesystem AFS.

metadata.title: DSA-3564-1 -- chromium-browser -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities have been discovered in the chromium web browser.

metadata.title: DSA-3539-1 -- srtp -- security update
metadata.description: Randell Jesup and the Firefox team discovered that srtp, Cisco's reference implementation of the Secure Real-time Transport Protocol (SRTP), does not properly handle RTP header CSRC count and extension header length. A remote attacker can exploit this vulnerability to crash an application linked against libsrtp, resulting in a denial of service.

metadata.title: DSA-3549-1 -- chromium-browser -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities have been discovered in the chromium web browser.

metadata.title: DSA-3504-1 -- bsh -- security update
metadata.description: Alvaro Muñoz and Christian Schneider discovered that BeanShell, an embeddable Java source interpreter, could be leveraged to execute arbitrary commands: applications including BeanShell in their classpath are vulnerable to this flaw if they deserialize data from an untrusted source.

metadata.title: DSA-3528-1 -- pidgin-otr -- security update
metadata.description: Stefan Sperling discovered that pidgin-otr, a Pidgin plugin implementing Off-The-Record messaging, contained a use-after-free bug. This could be used by a malicious remote user to intentionally crash the application, thus causing a denial-of-service.

metadata.title: DSA-3507-1 -- chromium-browser -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities have been discovered in the chromium web browser.

metadata.title: DSA-3513-1 -- chromium-browser -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities have been discovered in the chromium web browser.

metadata.title: DSA-3515-1 -- graphite2 -- security update
metadata.description: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in the Graphite font rendering engine which might result in denial of service or the execution of arbitrary code if a malformed font file is processed.

metadata.title: DSA-3534-1 -- dhcpcd -- security update
metadata.description: Guido Vranken discovered several vulnerabilities in dhcpcd, a DHCP client, which may result in denial of service.

metadata.title: DSA-3546-1 -- optipng -- security update
metadata.description: Hans Jerry Illikainen discovered that missing input sanitising in the BMP processing code of the optipng PNG optimiser may result in denial of service or the execution of arbitrary code if a malformed file is processed.

metadata.title: DSA-359-1 -- atari800 -- buffer overflows
metadata.description: Steve Kemp discovered multiple buffer overflows in atari800, an Atari emulator. In order to directly access graphics hardware, one of the affected programs is setuid root. A local attacker could exploit this vulnerability to gain root privileges.

metadata.title: DSA-3509-1 -- rails -- security update
metadata.description: Two vulnerabilities have been discovered in Rails, a web application framework written in Ruby. Both vulnerabilities affect Action Pack, which handles the web requests for Rails.

metadata.title: DSA-3565-1 -- botan1.10 -- security update
metadata.description: Several security vulnerabilities were found in botan1.10, a C++ library which provides support for many common cryptographic operations, including encryption, authentication, X.509v3 certificates and CRLs.

metadata.title: DSA-3540-1 -- lhasa -- security update
metadata.description: Marcin Noga discovered an integer underflow in Lhasa, a lzh archive decompressor, which might result in the execution of arbitrary code if a malformed archive is processed.

metadata.title: DSA-3526-1 -- libmatroska -- security update
metadata.description: It was discovered that libmatroska, an extensible open standard audio/video container format, incorrectly processed EBML lacing. By providing maliciously crafted input, an attacker could use this flaw to force some leakage of information located in the process heap memory.

metadata.title: DSA-3532-1 -- quagga -- security update
metadata.description: Kostya Kortchinsky discovered a stack-based buffer overflow vulnerability in the VPNv4 NLRI parser in bgpd in quagga, a BGP/OSPF/RIP routing daemon. A remote attacker can exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service (daemon crash), or potentially, execution of arbitrary code, if bgpd is configured with BGP peers enabled for VPNv4.

metadata.title: DSA-3523-1 -- iceweasel -- security update
metadata.description: This update disables the Graphite font shaping library in Iceweasel, Debian's version of the Mozilla Firefox web browser.

metadata.title: DSA-3560-1 -- php5 -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities were found in PHP, a general-purpose scripting language commonly used for web application development.

metadata.title: DSA-3520-1 -- icedove -- security update
metadata.description: Multiple security issues have been found in Icedove, Debian's version of the Mozilla Thunderbird mail client: Multiple memory safety errors, integer overflows, buffer overflows and other implementation errors may lead to the execution of arbitrary code or denial of service.

metadata.title: DSA-3502-1 -- roundup -- security update
metadata.description: Ralf Schlatterbeck discovered an information leak in roundup, a web-based issue tracking system. An authenticated attacker could use it to see sensitive details about other users, including their hashed password.

metadata.title: DSA-3556-1 -- libgd2 -- security update
metadata.description: Hans Jerry Illikainen discovered that libgd2, a library for programmatic graphics creation and manipulation, suffers of a signedness vulnerability which may result in a heap overflow when processing specially crafted compressed gd2 data. A remote attacker can take advantage of this flaw to cause an application using the libgd2 library to crash, or potentially, to execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the application.

metadata.title: DSA-3543-1 -- oar -- security update
metadata.description: Emmanuel Thome discovered that missing sanitising in the oarsh command of OAR, a software used to manage jobs and resources of HPC clusters, could result in privilege escalation.

metadata.title: DSA-3554-1 -- xen -- security update
metadata.description: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in the Xen hypervisor.

metadata.title: DSA-357-1 -- wu-ftpd -- remote root exploit
metadata.description: iSEC Security Research reports that wu-ftpd contains an off-by-one bug in the fb_realpath function which could be exploited by a logged-in user (local or anonymous) to gain root privileges. A demonstration exploit is reportedly available.

metadata.title: DSA-3557-1 -- mysql-5.5 -- security update
metadata.description: Several issues have been discovered in the MySQL database server. The vulnerabilities are addressed by upgrading MySQL to the new upstream version 5.5.49. Please see the MySQL 5.5 Release Notes and Oracle's Critical Patch Update advisory for further details.

metadata.title: DSA-356-1 -- xtokkaetama -- buffer overflows
metadata.description: Steve Kemp discovered two buffer overflows in xtokkaetama, a puzzle game, when processing the -display command line option and the XTOKKAETAMADIR environment variable. These vulnerabilities could be exploited by a local attacker to gain gid 'games'.

metadata.title: DSA-3536-1 -- libstruts1.2-java -- security update
metadata.description: It was discovered that libstruts1.2-java, a Java framework for MVC applications, contains a bug in its multi-page validation code. This allows input validation to be bypassed, even if MPV is not used directly.

metadata.title: DSA-3503-1 -- linux -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities have been discovered in the Linux kernel that may lead to a privilege escalation, denial of service, information leak or data loss.

metadata.title: DSA-3561-1 -- subversion -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities were discovered in Subversion, a version control system.

metadata.title: DSA-3545-1 -- cgit -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities were discovered in cgit, a fast web frontend for git repositories written in C. A remote attacker can take advantage of these flaws to perform cross-site scripting, header injection or denial of service attacks.

metadata.title: DSA-3562-1 -- tardiff -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities were discovered in tardiff, a tarball comparison tool.

metadata.title: DSA-3521-1 -- git -- security update
metadata.description: Lael Cellier discovered two buffer overflow vulnerabilities in git, a fast, scalable, distributed revision control system, which could be exploited for remote execution of arbitrary code.

metadata.title: DSA-3501-1 -- perl -- security update
metadata.description: Stephane Chazelas discovered a bug in the environment handling in Perl. Perl provides a Perl-space hash variable, %ENV, in which environment variables can be looked up. If a variable appears twice in envp, only the last value would appear in %ENV, but getenv would return the first. Perl's taint security mechanism would be applied to the value in %ENV, but not to the other rest of the environment. This could result in an ambiguous environment causing environment variables to be propagated to subprocesses, despite the protections supposedly offered by taint checking.

metadata.title: DSA-3522-1 -- squid3 -- security update
metadata.description: Alex Rousskov from The Measurement Factory discovered that Squid3, a fully featured web proxy cache, does not properly handle errors for certain malformed HTTP responses. A remote HTTP server can exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service (assertion failure and daemon exit).

metadata.title: DSA-3517-1 -- exim4 -- security update
metadata.description: A local root privilege escalation vulnerability was found in Exim, Debian's default mail transfer agent, in configurations using the <q>perl_startup</q> option (Only Exim via exim4-daemon-heavy enables Perl support).

metadata.title: DSA-3553-1 -- varnish -- security update
metadata.description: Régis Leroy from Makina Corpus discovered that varnish, a caching HTTP reverse proxy, is vulnerable to HTTP smuggling issues, potentially resulting in cache poisoning or bypassing of access control policies.

metadata.title: DSA-3533-1 -- openvswitch -- security update
metadata.description: Kashyap Thimmaraju and Bhargava Shastry discovered a remotely triggerable buffer overflow vulnerability in openvswitch, a production quality, multilayer virtual switch implementation. Specially crafted MPLS packets could overflow the buffer reserved for MPLS labels in an OVS internal data structure. A remote attacker can take advantage of this flaw to cause a denial of service, or potentially, execution of arbitrary code.

metadata.title: DSA-3524-1 -- activemq -- security update
metadata.description: It was discovered that the ActiveMQ Java message broker performs unsafe deserialisation.

metadata.title: DSA-3531-1 -- chromium-browser -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities have been discovered in the chromium web browser.

metadata.title: DSA-3572-1 -- websvn -- security update
metadata.description: Nitin Venkatesh discovered that websvn, a web viewer for Subversion repositories, is susceptible to cross-site scripting attacks via specially crafted file and directory names in repositories.

metadata.title: DSA-3568-1 -- libtasn1-6 -- security update
metadata.description: Pascal Cuoq and Miod Vallat discovered that Libtasn1, a library to manage ASN.1 structures, does not correctly handle certain malformed DER certificates. A remote attacker can take advantage of this flaw to cause an application using the Libtasn1 library to hang, resulting in a denial of service.

metadata.title: DSA-3571-1 -- ikiwiki -- security update
metadata.description: Simon McVittie discovered a cross-site scripting vulnerability in the error reporting of Ikiwiki, a wiki compiler. This update also hardens ikiwiki's use of imagemagick in the img plugin.

metadata.title: DSA-3559-1 -- iceweasel -- security update
metadata.description: Multiple security issues have been found in Iceweasel, Debian's version of the Mozilla Firefox web browser: Multiple memory safety errors and buffer overflows may lead to the execution of arbitrary code or denial of service.

metadata.title: DSA-3551-1 -- fuseiso -- security update
metadata.description: It was discovered that fuseiso, a user-space implementation of the ISO 9660 file system based on FUSE, contains several vulnerabilities.

metadata.title: DSA-3510-1 -- iceweasel -- security update
metadata.description: Multiple security issues have been found in Iceweasel, Debian's version of the Mozilla Firefox web browser: Multiple memory safety errors, buffer overflows, use-after-frees and other implementation errors may lead to the execution of arbitrary code, denial of service, address bar spoofing and overwriting local files.

metadata.title: DSA-3530-1 -- tomcat6 -- security update
metadata.description: Multiple security vulnerabilities have been fixed in the Tomcat servlet and JSP engine, which may result on bypass of security manager restrictions, information disclosure, denial of service or session fixation.

metadata.title: DSA-3555-1 -- imlib2 -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities were discovered in imlib2, an image manipulation library.

metadata.title: DSA-3547-1 -- imagemagick -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities were discovered in Imagemagick, a program suite for image manipulation. This update fixes a large number of potential security problems such as null-pointer access and buffer-overflows that might lead to memory leaks or denial of service. None of these security problems have a CVE number assigned.

metadata.title: DSA-354 -- xconq -- buffer overflows
metadata.description: Steve Kemp discovered a buffer overflow in xconq, in processing the USER environment variable. In the process of fixing this bug, a similar problem was discovered with the DISPLAY environment variable. This vulnerability could be exploited by a local attacker to gain gid 'games'.

metadata.title: DSA-3575-1 -- libxstream-java -- security update
metadata.description: It was discovered that XStream, a Java library to serialize objects to XML and back again, was susceptible to XML External Entity attacks.

metadata.title: DSA-3574-1 -- libarchive -- security update
metadata.description: Rock Stevens, Andrew Ruef and Marcin <q>Icewall</q> Noga discovered a heap-based buffer overflow vulnerability in the zip_read_mac_metadata function in libarchive, a multi-format archive and compression library, which may lead to the execution of arbitrary code if a user or automated system is tricked into processing a specially crafted ZIP file.

metadata.title: DSA-3511-1 -- bind9 -- security update
metadata.description: Two vulnerabilites have been discovered in ISC's BIND DNS server.

metadata.title: DSA-3525-1 -- pixman -- security update
metadata.description: Vincent LE GARREC discovered an integer overflow in pixman, a pixel-manipulation library for X and cairo. A remote attacker can exploit this flaw to cause an application using the pixman library to crash, or potentially, to execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the application.

metadata.title: DSA-3565-2 -- botan1.10 -- security update
metadata.description: Several security vulnerabilities were found in botan1.10, a C++ library which provides support for many common cryptographic operations, including encryption, authentication, X.509v3 certificates and CRLs.

metadata.title: DSA-3570-1 -- mercurial -- security update
metadata.description: Blake Burkhart discovered an arbitrary code execution flaw in Mercurial, a distributed version control system, when using the convert extension on Git repositories with specially crafted names. This flaw in particular affects automated code conversion services that allow arbitrary repository names.

metadata.title: DSA-3558-1 -- openjdk-7 -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities have been discovered in OpenJDK, an implementation of the Oracle Java platform, resulting in breakouts of the Java sandbox, denial of service or information disclosure.

metadata.title: DSA-3544-1 -- python-django -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities were discovered in Django, a high-level Python web development framework.

metadata.title: DSA-3500-1 -- openssl -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities were discovered in OpenSSL, a Secure Socket Layer toolkit.

metadata.title: DSA-3573-1 -- qemu -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities were discovered in qemu, a fast processor emulator.

metadata.title: DSA-3563-1 -- poppler -- security update
metadata.description: It was discovered that a heap overflow in the Poppler PDF library may result in denial of service and potentially the execution of arbitrary code if a malformed PDF file is opened.

metadata.title: DSA-3527-1 -- inspircd -- security update
metadata.description: It was discovered that inspircd, an IRC daemon, incorrectly handled PTR lookups of connecting users. This flaw allowed a remote attacker to crash the application by setting up malformed DNS records, thus causing a denial-of-service,

metadata.title: DSA-3512-1 -- libotr -- security update
metadata.description: Markus Vervier of X41 D-Sec GmbH discovered an integer overflow vulnerability in libotr, an off-the-record (OTR) messaging library, in the way how the sizes of portions of incoming messages were stored. A remote attacker can exploit this flaw by sending crafted messages to an application that is using libotr to perform denial of service attacks (application crash), or potentially, execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the application.

metadata.title: DSA-3552-1 -- tomcat7 -- security update
metadata.description: Multiple security vulnerabilities have been discovered in the Tomcat servlet and JSP engine, which may result in information disclosure, the bypass of CSRF protections and bypass of the SecurityManager.

metadata.title: DSA-3548-1 -- samba -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities have been discovered in Samba, a SMB/CIFS file, print, and login server for Unix.

metadata.title: DSA-3580-1 -- imagemagick -- security update
metadata.description: Nikolay Ermishkin from the Mail.Ru Security Team and Stewie discovered several vulnerabilities in ImageMagick, a program suite for image manipulation. These vulnerabilities, collectively known as ImageTragick, are the consequence of lack of sanitization of untrusted input. An attacker with control on the image input could, with the privileges of the user running the application, execute code (CVE-2016-3714), make HTTP GET or FTP requests (CVE-2016-3718), or delete (CVE-2016-3715), move (CVE-2016-3716), or read (CVE-2016-3717) local files.

metadata.title: DSA-3597-1 -- expat -- security update
metadata.description: Two related issues have been discovered in Expat, a C library for parsing XML.

metadata.title: DSA-3600-1 -- firefox-esr -- security update
metadata.description: Multiple security issues have been found in the Mozilla Firefox web browser: Multiple memory safety errors, buffer overflows and other implementation errors may lead to the execution of arbitrary code or spoofing.

metadata.title: DSA-3582-1 -- expat -- security update
metadata.description: Gustavo Grieco discovered that Expat, an XML parsing C library, does not properly handle certain kinds of malformed input documents, resulting in buffer overflows during processing and error reporting. A remote attacker can take advantage of this flaw to cause an application using the Expat library to crash, or potentially, to execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the application.

metadata.title: DSA-3576-1 -- icedove -- security update
metadata.description: Multiple security issues have been found in Icedove, Debian's version of the Mozilla Thunderbird mail client: Multiple memory safety errors may lead to the execution of arbitrary code or denial of service.

metadata.title: DSA-3601-1 -- icedove -- security update
metadata.description: Multiple security issues have been found in Icedove, Debian's version of the Mozilla Thunderbird mail client: Multiple memory safety errors may lead to the execution of arbitrary code or denial of service.

metadata.title: DSA-3577-1 -- jansson -- security update
metadata.description: Gustavo Grieco discovered that jansson, a C library for encoding, decoding and manipulating JSON data, did not limit the recursion depth when parsing JSON arrays and objects. This could allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via stack exhaustion, using crafted JSON data.

metadata.title: DSA-3579-1 -- xerces-c -- security update
metadata.description: Gustavo Grieco discovered an use-after-free vulnerability in xerces-c, a validating XML parser library for C++, due to not properly handling invalid characters in XML input documents in the DTDScanner.

metadata.title: DSA-3589-1 -- gdk-pixbuf -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities have been discovered in gdk-pixbuf, a toolkit for image loading and pixel buffer manipulation. A remote attacker can take advantage of these flaws to cause a denial-of-service against an application using gdk-pixbuf (application crash), or potentially, to execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the application, if a malformed image is opened.

metadata.title: DSA-3583-1 -- swift-plugin-s3 -- security update
metadata.description: It was discovered that the swift3 (S3 compatibility) middleware plugin for Swift performed insufficient validation of date headers which might result in replay attacks.

metadata.title: DSA-3581-1 -- libndp -- security update
metadata.description: Julien Bernard discovered that libndp, a library for the IPv6 Neighbor Discovery Protocol, does not properly perform input and origin checks during the reception of a NDP message. An attacker in a non-local network could use this flaw to advertise a node as a router, and cause a denial of service attack, or act as a man-in-the-middle.

metadata.title: DSA-3548-3 -- samba -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities have been discovered in Samba, a SMB/CIFS file, print, and login server for Unix.

metadata.title: DSA-3598-1 -- vlc -- security update
metadata.description: Patrick Coleman discovered that missing input sanitising in the ADPCM decoder of the VLC media player may result in the execution of arbitrary code if a malformed media file is opened.

metadata.title: DSA-3594-1 -- chromium-browser -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities have been discovered in the chromium web browser.

metadata.title: DSA-3591-1 -- imagemagick -- security update
metadata.description: Bob Friesenhahn from the GraphicsMagick project discovered a command injection vulnerability in ImageMagick, a program suite for image manipulation. An attacker with control on input image or the input filename can execute arbitrary commands with the privileges of the user running the application.

metadata.title: DSA-3584-1 -- librsvg -- security update
metadata.description: Gustavo Grieco discovered several flaws in the way librsvg, a SAX-based renderer library for SVG files, parses SVG files with circular definitions. A remote attacker can take advantage of these flaws to cause an application using the librsvg library to crash.

metadata.title: DSA-3590-1 -- chromium-browser -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities have been discovered in the chromium web browser.

metadata.title: DSA-3587-1 -- libgd2 -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities were discovered in libgd2, a library for programmatic graphics creation and manipulation. A remote attacker can take advantage of these flaws to cause a denial-of-service against an application using the libgd2 library.

metadata.title: DSA-3599-1 -- p7zip -- security update
metadata.description: Marcin <q>Icewall</q> Noga of Cisco Talos discovered an out-of-bound read vulnerability in the CInArchive::ReadFileItem method in p7zip, a 7zr file archiver with high compression ratio. A remote attacker can take advantage of this flaw to cause a denial-of-service or, potentially the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running p7zip, if a specially crafted UDF file is processed.

metadata.title: DSA-3596-1 -- spice -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities were discovered in spice, a SPICE protocol client and server library.

metadata.title: DSA-3593-1 -- libxml2 -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities were discovered in libxml2, a library providing support to read, modify and write XML and HTML files. A remote attacker could provide a specially crafted XML or HTML file that, when processed by an application using libxml2, would cause a denial-of-service against the application, or potentially the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the application.

metadata.title: DSA-3585-1 -- wireshark -- security update
metadata.description: Multiple vulnerabilities were discovered in the dissectors/parsers for PKTC, IAX2, GSM CBCH and NCP which could result in denial of service.

metadata.title: DSA-3595-1 -- mariadb-10.0 -- security update
metadata.description: Several issues have been discovered in the MariaDB database server. The vulnerabilities are addressed by upgrading MariaDB to the new upstream version 10.0.25. Please see the MariaDB 10.0 Release Notes for further details.

metadata.title: DSA-3592-1 -- nginx -- security update
metadata.description: It was discovered that a NULL pointer dereference in the Nginx code responsible for saving client request bodies to a temporary file might result in denial of service: Malformed requests could crash worker processes.

metadata.title: DSA-3586-1 -- atheme-services -- security update
metadata.description: It was discovered that a buffer overflow in the XMLRPC response encoding code of the Atheme IRC services may result in denial of service.

metadata.title: DSA-3578-1 -- libidn -- security update
metadata.description: It was discovered that libidn, the GNU library for Internationalized Domain Names (IDNs), did not correctly handle invalid UTF-8 input, causing an out-of-bounds read. This could allow attackers to disclose sensitive information from an application using the libidn library.

metadata.title: DSA-3588-1 -- symfony -- security update
metadata.description: Two vulnerabilities were discovered in Symfony, a PHP framework.

metadata.title: HPE HP-UX running Apache Tomcat 7, Multiple Remote Vulnerabilities
metadata.description: The Mapper component in Apache Tomcat 6.x before 6.0.45, 7.x before 7.0.68, 8.x before 8.0.30, and 9.x before 9.0.0.M2 processes redirects before considering security constraints and Filters, which allows remote attackers to determine the existence of a directory via a URL that lacks a trailing / (slash) character.

criterion.comment: hpuxws22TOMCAT.TOMCAT version is less than D.7.0.68.01
hpuxws22TOMCAT.TOMCAT2 version is less than D.7.0.68.01

metadata.title: HPE HP-UX running Apache Tomcat 7, Multiple Remote Vulnerabilities
metadata.description: The session-persistence implementation in Apache Tomcat 6.x before 6.0.45, 7.x before 7.0.68, 8.x before 8.0.31, and 9.x before 9.0.0.M2 mishandles session attributes, which allows remote authenticated users to bypass intended SecurityManager restrictions and execute arbitrary code in a privileged context via a web application that places a crafted object in a session.

criterion.comment: hpuxws22TOMCAT.TOMCAT version is less than D.7.0.68.01
hpuxws22TOMCAT.TOMCAT2 version is less than D.7.0.68.01

metadata.title: HPE HP-UX running Apache Tomcat 7, Multiple Remote Vulnerabilities
metadata.description: Session fixation vulnerability in Apache Tomcat 7.x before 7.0.66, 8.x before 8.0.30, and 9.x before 9.0.0.M2, when different session settings are used for deployments of multiple versions of the same web application, might allow remote attackers to hijack web sessions by leveraging use of a requestedSessionSSL field for an unintended request, related to CoyoteAdapter.java and Request.java.

criterion.comment: hpuxws22TOMCAT.TOMCAT version is less than D.7.0.68.01
hpuxws22TOMCAT.TOMCAT2 version is less than D.7.0.68.01

metadata.title: HPE HP-UX running Apache Tomcat 7, Multiple Remote Vulnerabilities
metadata.description: Apache Tomcat 6.x before 6.0.45, 7.x before 7.0.68, 8.x before 8.0.31, and 9.x before 9.0.0.M2 does not place org.apache.catalina.manager.StatusManagerServlet on the org/apache/catalina/core/RestrictedServlets.properties list, which allows remote authenticated users to bypass intended SecurityManager restrictions and read arbitrary HTTP requests, and consequently discover session ID values, via a crafted web application.

criterion.comment: hpuxws22TOMCAT.TOMCAT version is less than D.7.0.68.01
hpuxws22TOMCAT.TOMCAT2 version is less than D.7.0.68.01

metadata.title: HPE HP-UX running Apache Tomcat 7, Multiple Remote Vulnerabilities
metadata.description: The setGlobalContext method in org/apache/naming/factory/ResourceLinkFactory.java in Apache Tomcat 7.x before 7.0.68, 8.x before 8.0.31, and 9.x before 9.0.0.M3 does not consider whether ResourceLinkFactory.setGlobalContext callers are authorized, which allows remote authenticated users to bypass intended SecurityManager restrictions and read or write to arbitrary application data, or cause a denial of service (application disruption), via a web application that sets a crafted global context.

criterion.comment: hpuxws22TOMCAT.TOMCAT version is less than D.7.0.68.01
hpuxws22TOMCAT.TOMCAT2 version is less than D.7.0.68.01

metadata.title: HPE HP-UX running Apache Tomcat 7, Multiple Remote Vulnerabilities
metadata.description: The (1) Manager and (2) Host Manager applications in Apache Tomcat 7.x before 7.0.68, 8.x before 8.0.31, and 9.x before 9.0.0.M2 establish sessions and send CSRF tokens for arbitrary new requests, which allows remote attackers to bypass a CSRF protection mechanism by using a token.

criterion.comment: hpuxws22TOMCAT.TOMCAT version is less than D.7.0.68.01
hpuxws22TOMCAT.TOMCAT2 version is less than D.7.0.68.01

metadata.title: HPE HP-UX running Apache Tomcat 7, Multiple Remote Vulnerabilities
metadata.description: Directory traversal vulnerability in RequestUtil.java in Apache Tomcat 6.x before 6.0.45, 7.x before 7.0.65, and 8.x before 8.0.27 allows remote authenticated users to bypass intended SecurityManager restrictions and list a parent directory via a /.. (slash dot dot) in a pathname used by a web application in a getResource, getResourceAsStream, or getResourcePaths call, as demonstrated by the $CATALINA_BASE/webapps directory.

criterion.comment: hpuxws22TOMCAT.TOMCAT version is less than D.7.0.68.01
hpuxws22TOMCAT.TOMCAT2 version is less than D.7.0.68.01

metadata.title: DSA-3610-1 -- xerces-c -- security update
metadata.description: Brandon Perry discovered that xerces-c, a validating XML parser library for C++, fails to successfully parse a DTD that is deeply nested, causing a stack overflow. A remote unauthenticated attacker can take advantage of this flaw to cause a denial of service against applications using the xerces-c library.

metadata.title: DSA-3606-1 -- libpdfbox-java -- security update
metadata.description: It was discovered that pdfbox, a PDF library for Java, was susceptible to XML External Entity attacks.

metadata.title: DSA-3609-1 -- tomcat8 -- security update
metadata.description: Multiple security vulnerabilities have been discovered in the Tomcat servlet and JSP engine, which may result in information disclosure, the bypass of CSRF protections, bypass of the SecurityManager or denial of service.

metadata.title: DSA-3608-1 -- libreoffice -- security update
metadata.description: Aleksandar Nikolic discovered that missing input sanitising in the RTF parser in Libreoffice may result in the execution of arbitrary code if a malformed documented is opened.

metadata.title: DSA-3605-1 -- libxslt -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities were discovered in libxslt, an XSLT processing runtime library, which could lead to information disclosure or denial-of-service (application crash) against an application using the libxslt library.

metadata.title: DSA-3607-1 -- linux -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities have been discovered in the Linux kernel that may lead to a privilege escalation, denial of service or information leaks.

metadata.title: DSA-3602-1 -- php5 -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities were found in PHP, a general-purpose scripting language commonly used for web application development.

metadata.title: DSA-3611-1 -- libcommons-fileupload-java -- security update
metadata.description: The TERASOLUNA Framework Development Team discovered a denial of service vulnerability in Apache Commons FileUpload, a package to make it easy to add robust, high-performance, file upload capability to servlets and web applications. A remote attacker can take advantage of this flaw by sending file upload requests that cause the HTTP server using the Apache Commons Fileupload library to become unresponsive, preventing the server from servicing other requests.

metadata.title: DSA-3604-1 -- drupal7 -- security update
metadata.description: A privilege escalation vulnerability has been found in the User module of the Drupal content management framework. For additional information, please refer to the upstream advisory at https://www.drupal.org/SA-CORE-2016-002.

metadata.title: DSA-3603-1 -- libav -- security update
metadata.description: Several security issues have been corrected in multiple demuxers and decoders of the libav multimedia library.

metadata.title: DSA-3623-1 -- apache2 -- security update
metadata.description: Scott Geary of VendHQ discovered that the Apache HTTPD server used the value of the Proxy header from HTTP requests to initialize the HTTP_PROXY environment variable for CGI scripts, which in turn was incorrectly used by certain HTTP client implementations to configure the proxy for outgoing HTTP requests. A remote attacker could possibly use this flaw to redirect HTTP requests performed by a CGI script to an attacker-controlled proxy via a malicious HTTP request.

metadata.title: DSA-3621-1 -- mysql-connector-java -- security update
metadata.description: A vulnerability was discovered in mysql-connector-java, a Java database (JDBC) driver for MySQL, which may result in unauthorized update, insert or delete access to some MySQL Connectors accessible data as well as read access to a subset of MySQL Connectors accessible data. The vulnerability was addressed by upgrading mysql-connector-java to the new upstream version 5.1.39, which includes additional changes, such as bug fixes, new features, and possibly incompatible changes. Please see the MySQL Connector/J Release Notes and Oracle's Critical Patch Update advisory for further details.

metadata.title: DSA-3616-1 -- linux -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities have been discovered in the Linux kernel that may lead to a privilege escalation, denial of service or information leaks.

metadata.title: DSA-3620-1 -- pidgin -- security update
metadata.description: Yves Younan of Cisco Talos discovered several vulnerabilities in the MXit protocol support in pidgin, a multi-protocol instant messaging client. A remote attacker can take advantage of these flaws to cause a denial of service (application crash), overwrite files, information disclosure, or potentially to execute arbitrary code.

metadata.title: DSA-3624-1 -- mysql-5.5 -- security update
metadata.description: Several issues have been discovered in the MySQL database server. The vulnerabilities are addressed by upgrading MySQL to the new upstream version 5.5.50. Please see the MySQL 5.5 Release Notes and Oracle's Critical Patch Update advisory for further details.

metadata.title: DSA-3614-1 -- tomcat7 -- security update
metadata.description: The TERASOLUNA Framework Development Team discovered a denial of service vulnerability in Apache Commons FileUpload, a package to make it easy to add robust, high-performance, file upload capability to servlets and web applications. A remote attacker can take advantage of this flaw by sending file upload requests that cause the HTTP server using the Apache Commons Fileupload library to become unresponsive, preventing the server from servicing other requests.

metadata.title: DSA-3617-1 -- horizon -- security update
metadata.description: Two cross-site scripting vulnerabilities have been found in Horizon, a web application to control an OpenStack cloud.

metadata.title: DSA-3613-1 -- libvirt -- security update
metadata.description: Vivian Zhang and Christoph Anton Mitterer discovered that setting an empty VNC password does not work as documented in Libvirt, a virtualisation abstraction library. When the password on a VNC server is set to the empty string, authentication on the VNC server will be disabled, allowing any user to connect, despite the documentation declaring that setting an empty password for the VNC server prevents all client connections. With this update the behaviour is enforced by setting the password expiration to <q>now</q>.

metadata.title: DSA-3619-1 -- libgd2 -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities were discovered in libgd2, a library for programmatic graphics creation and manipulation. A remote attacker can take advantage of these flaws to cause a denial-of-service against an application using the libgd2 library (application crash), or potentially to execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the application.

metadata.title: DSA-3622-1 -- python-django -- security update
metadata.description: It was discovered that Django, a high-level Python web development framework, is prone to a cross-site scripting vulnerability in the admin's add/change related popup.

metadata.title: DSA-3612-1 -- gimp -- security update
metadata.description: Shmuel H discovered that GIMP, the GNU Image Manipulation Program, is prone to a use-after-free vulnerability in the channel and layer properties parsing process when loading a XCF file. An attacker can take advantage of this flaw to potentially execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running GIMP if a specially crafted XCF file is processed.

metadata.title: DSA-3618-1 -- php5 -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities were found in PHP, a general-purpose scripting language commonly used for web application development.

metadata.title: DSA-3615-1 -- wireshark -- security update
metadata.description: Multiple vulnerabilities were discovered in the dissectors/parsers for PKTC, IAX2, GSM CBCH and NCP, SPOOLS, IEEE 802.11, UMTS FP, USB, Toshiba, CoSine, NetScreen, WBXML which could result in denial of service or potentially the execution of arbitrary code.

metadata.title: DSA-3636-1 -- collectd -- security update
metadata.description: Emilien Gaspar discovered that collectd, a statistics collection and monitoring daemon, incorrectly processed incoming network packets. This resulted in a heap overflow, allowing a remote attacker to either cause a DoS via application crash, or potentially execute arbitrary code.

metadata.title: DSA-3641-1 -- openjdk-7 -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities have been discovered in OpenJDK, an implementation of the Oracle Java platform, resulting in breakouts of the Java sandbox or denial of service.

metadata.title: DSA-3638-1 -- curl -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities were discovered in cURL, an URL transfer library.

metadata.title: DSA-3637-1 -- chromium-browser -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities have been discovered in the chromium web browser.

metadata.title: DSA-3628-1 -- perl -- security update
metadata.description: Multiple vulnerabilities were discovered in the implementation of the Perl programming language.

metadata.title: DSA-3635-1 -- libdbd-mysql-perl -- security update
metadata.description: Two use-after-free vulnerabilities were discovered in DBD::mysql, a Perl DBI driver for the MySQL database server. A remote attacker can take advantage of these flaws to cause a denial-of-service against an application using DBD::mysql (application crash), or potentially to execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the application.

metadata.title: DSA-3634-1 -- redis -- security update
metadata.description: It was discovered that redis, a persistent key-value database, did not properly protect redis-cli history files: they were created by default with world-readable permissions.

metadata.title: DSA-3645-1 -- chromium-browser -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilites have been discovered in the chromium web browser.

metadata.title: DSA-3646-1 -- postgresql-9.4 -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities have been found in PostgreSQL-9.4, a SQL database system.

metadata.title: DSA-3642-1 -- lighttpd -- security update
metadata.description: Dominic Scheirlinck and Scott Geary of Vend reported insecure behavior in the lighttpd web server. Lighttpd assigned Proxy header values from client requests to internal HTTP_PROXY environment variables, allowing remote attackers to carry out Man in the Middle (MITM) attacks or initiate connections to arbitrary hosts.

metadata.title: DSA-3625-1 -- squid3 -- security update
metadata.description: Several security issues have been discovered in the Squid caching proxy.

metadata.title: DSA-3631-1 -- php5 -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities were found in PHP, a general-purpose scripting language commonly used for web application development.

metadata.title: DSA-3647-1 -- icedove -- security update
metadata.description: Multiple security issues have been found in Icedove, Debian's version of the Mozilla Thunderbird mail client: Multiple memory safety errors may lead to the execution of arbitrary code or denial of service.

metadata.title: DSA-3632-1 -- mariadb-10.0 -- security update
metadata.description: Several issues have been discovered in the MariaDB database server. The vulnerabilities are addressed by upgrading MariaDB to the new upstream version 10.0.26. Please see the MariaDB 10.0 Release Notes for further details.

metadata.title: DSA-3633-1 -- xen -- security update
metadata.description: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in the Xen hypervisor.

metadata.title: DSA-3626-1 -- openssh -- security update
metadata.description: Eddie Harari reported that the OpenSSH SSH daemon allows user enumeration through timing differences when trying to authenticate users. When sshd tries to authenticate a non-existing user, it will pick up a fixed fake password structure with a hash based on the Blowfish algorithm. If real users passwords are hashed using SHA256/SHA512, then a remote attacker can take advantage of this flaw by sending large passwords, receiving shorter response times from the server for non-existing users.

metadata.title: DSA-363-1 -- postfix -- denial of service, bounce-scanning
metadata.description: The postfix mail transport agent in Debian 3.0 contains two vulnerabilities.

metadata.title: DSA-3629-1 -- ntp -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities were discovered in the Network Time Protocol daemon and utility programs.

metadata.title: DSA-3630-1 -- libgd2 -- security update
metadata.description: Secunia Research at Flexera Software discovered an integer overflow vulnerability within the _gdContributionsAlloc() function in libgd2, a library for programmatic graphics creation and manipulation. A remote attacker can take advantage of this flaw to cause a denial-of-service against an application using the libgd2 library.

metadata.title: DSA-3627-1 -- phpmyadmin -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities have been fixed in phpMyAdmin, the web-based MySQL administration interface.

metadata.title: DSA-3639-1 -- wordpress -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities were discovered in wordpress, a web blogging tool, which could allow remote attackers to compromise a site via cross-site scripting, bypass restrictions, obtain sensitive revision-history information, or mount a denial of service.

metadata.title: DSA-362-1 -- mindi -- insecure temporary file
metadata.description: mindi, a program for creating boot/root disks, does not take appropriate security precautions when creating temporary files. This bug could potentially be exploited to overwrite arbitrary files with the privileges of the user running mindi.

metadata.title: DSA-364-3 -- man-db -- buffer overflows, arbitrary command execution
metadata.description: man-db provides the standard man(1) command on Debian systems. During configuration of this package, the administrator is asked whether man(1) should run setuid to a dedicated user ("man") in order to provide a shared cache of preformatted manual pages. The default is for man(1) NOT to be setuid, and in this configuration no known vulnerability exists. However, if the user explicitly requests setuid operation, a local attacker could exploit either of the following bugs to execute arbitrary code as the "man" user.

metadata.title: DSA-3648-1 -- wireshark -- security update
metadata.description: Multiple vulnerabilities were discovered in the dissectors for NDS, PacketBB, WSP, MMSE, RLC, LDSS, RLC and OpenFlow, which could result in denial of service or the execution of arbitrary code.

metadata.title: DSA-3644-1 -- fontconfig -- security update
metadata.description: Tobias Stoeckmann discovered that cache files are insufficiently validated in fontconfig, a generic font configuration library. An attacker can trigger arbitrary free() calls, which in turn allows double free attacks and therefore arbitrary code execution. In combination with setuid binaries using crafted cache files, this could allow privilege escalation.

metadata.title: DSA-3643-1 -- kde4libs -- security update
metadata.description: Andreas Cord-Landwehr discovered that kde4libs, the core libraries for all KDE 4 applications, do not properly handle the extraction of archives with "../" in the file paths. A remote attacker can take advantage of this flaw to overwrite files outside of the extraction folder, if a user is tricked into extracting a specially crafted archive.

metadata.title: DSA-3640-1 -- firefox-esr -- security update
metadata.description: Multiple security issues have been found in the Mozilla Firefox web browser: Multiple memory safety errors, buffer overflows and other implementation errors may lead to the execution of arbitrary code, cross-site scriping, information disclosure and bypass of the same-origin policy.

metadata.title: DSA-3672-1 -- irssi -- security update
metadata.description: Gabriel Campana and Adrien Guinet from Quarkslab discovered two remotely exploitable crash and heap corruption vulnerabilities in the format parsing code in Irssi, a terminal based IRC client.

metadata.title: DSA-3680-1 -- bind9 -- security update
metadata.description: Two vulnerabilities were reported in BIND, a DNS server.

metadata.title: DSA-3670-1 -- tomcat8 -- security update
metadata.description: Dawid Golunski of LegalHackers discovered that the Tomcat init script performed unsafe file handling, which could result in local privilege escalation.

metadata.title: DSA-3678-1 -- python-django -- security update
metadata.description: Sergey Bobrov discovered that cookie parsing in Django and Google Analytics interacted such a way that an attacker could set arbitrary cookies. This allows other malicious web sites to bypass the Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) protections built into Django.

metadata.title: DSA-3676-1 -- unadf -- security update
metadata.description: Tuomas Räsänen discovered two vulnerabilities in unADF, a tool to extract files from an Amiga Disk File dump (.adf).

metadata.title: DSA-3677-1 -- libarchive -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities were discovered in libarchive, a multi-format archive and compression library, which may lead to denial of service (memory consumption and application crash), bypass of sandboxing restrictions and overwrite arbitrary files with arbitrary data from an archive, or the execution of arbitrary code.

metadata.title: DSA-3664-1 -- pdns -- security update
metadata.description: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in pdns, an authoritative DNS server.

metadata.title: DSA-3675-1 -- imagemagick -- security update
metadata.description: This updates fixes several vulnerabilities in imagemagick: Various memory handling problems and cases of missing or incomplete input sanitising may result in denial of service or the execution of arbitrary code if malformed SIXEL, PDB, MAP, SGI, TIFF and CALS files are processed.

metadata.title: DSA-3674-1 -- firefox-esr -- security update
metadata.description: Multiple security issues have been found in the Mozilla Firefox web browser: Multiple memory safety errors, buffer overflows and other implementation errors may lead to the execution of arbitrary code or information disclosure.

metadata.title: DSA-3669-1 -- tomcat7 -- security update
metadata.description: Dawid Golunski of LegalHackers discovered that the Tomcat init script performed unsafe file handling, which could result in local privilege escalation.

metadata.title: DSA-3673-1 -- openssl -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities were discovered in OpenSSL.

metadata.title: DSA-3679-1 -- jackrabbit -- security update
metadata.description: Lukas Reschke discovered that Apache Jackrabbit, an implementation of the Content Repository for Java Technology API, did not correctly check the Content-Type header on HTTP POST requests, enabling Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) attacks by malicious web sites.

metadata.title: DSA-3668-1 -- mailman -- security update
metadata.description: It was discovered that there was a CSRF vulnerability in mailman, a web-based mailing list manager, which could allow an attacker to obtain a user's password.

metadata.title: DSA-3667-1 -- chromium-browser -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities have been discovered in the chromium web browser.

metadata.title: DSA-3671-1 -- wireshark -- security update
metadata.description: Multiple vulnerabilities were discovered in the dissectors for H.225, Catapult DCT2000, UMTS FP and IPMI, which could result in denial of service or the execution of arbitrary code.

metadata.title: DSA-3666-1 -- mysql-5.5 -- security update
metadata.description: Dawid Golunski discovered that the mysqld_safe wrapper provided by the MySQL database server insufficiently restricted the load path for custom malloc implementations, which could result in privilege escalation.

metadata.title: DSA-3681-1 -- wordpress -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities were discovered in wordpress, a web blogging tool, which could allow remote attackers to compromise a site via cross-site scripting, cross-site request forgery, path traversal, or bypass restrictions.

metadata.title: DSA-3665-1 -- openjpeg2 -- security update
metadata.description: Multiple vulnerabilities in OpenJPEG, a JPEG 2000 image compression / decompression library, may result in denial of service or the execution of arbitrary code if a malformed JPEG 2000 file is processed.

metadata.title: HPE HP-UX running CIFS Server (Samba), Remote Denial of Service (DoS), Disclosure of Information, Unauthorized Access
metadata.description: The MS-SAMR and MS-LSAD protocol implementations in Samba 3.x and 4.x before 4.2.11, 4.3.x before 4.3.8, and 4.4.x before 4.4.2 mishandle DCERPC connections, which allows man-in-the-middle attackers to perform protocol-downgrade attacks and impersonate users by modifying the client-server data stream, aka "BADLOCK."

criterion.comment: CIFS-Development.CIFS-PRG version is less than A.03.02.07
CIFS-Server.CIFS-ADMIN version is less than A.03.02.07
CIFS-Server.CIFS-DOC version is less than A.03.02.07
CIFS-Server.CIFS-LIB version is less than A.03.02.07
CIFS-Server.CIFS-RUN version is less than A.03.02.07
CIFS-Server.CIFS-UTIL version is less than A.03.02.07

metadata.title: HPE HP-UX running CIFS Server (Samba), Remote Denial of Service (DoS), Disclosure of Information, Unauthorized Access
metadata.description: Samba 3.x and 4.x before 4.2.11, 4.3.x before 4.3.8, and 4.4.x before 4.4.2 does not require SMB signing within a DCERPC session over ncacn_np, which allows man-in-the-middle attackers to spoof SMB clients by modifying the client-server data stream.

criterion.comment: CIFS-Development.CIFS-PRG version is less than A.03.02.07
CIFS-Server.CIFS-ADMIN version is less than A.03.02.07
CIFS-Server.CIFS-DOC version is less than A.03.02.07
CIFS-Server.CIFS-LIB version is less than A.03.02.07
CIFS-Server.CIFS-RUN version is less than A.03.02.07
CIFS-Server.CIFS-UTIL version is less than A.03.02.07

metadata.title: HPE HP-UX running CIFS Server (Samba), Remote Denial of Service (DoS), Disclosure of Information, Unauthorized Access
metadata.description: The NETLOGON service in Samba 3.x and 4.x before 4.2.11, 4.3.x before 4.3.8, and 4.4.x before 4.4.2, when a domain controller is configured, allows remote attackers to spoof the computer name of a secure channel's endpoint, and obtain sensitive session information, by running a crafted application and leveraging the ability to sniff network traffic, a related issue to CVE-2015-0005.

criterion.comment: CIFS-Development.CIFS-PRG version is less than A.03.02.07
CIFS-Server.CIFS-ADMIN version is less than A.03.02.07
CIFS-Server.CIFS-DOC version is less than A.03.02.07
CIFS-Server.CIFS-LIB version is less than A.03.02.07
CIFS-Server.CIFS-RUN version is less than A.03.02.07
CIFS-Server.CIFS-UTIL version is less than A.03.02.07

metadata.title: HPE HP-UX running CIFS Server (Samba), Remote Denial of Service (DoS), Disclosure of Information, Unauthorized Access
metadata.description: Samba 3.x and 4.x before 4.2.11, 4.3.x before 4.3.8, and 4.4.x before 4.4.2 does not properly implement the DCE-RPC layer, which allows remote attackers to perform protocol-downgrade attacks, cause a denial of service (application crash or CPU consumption), or possibly execute arbitrary code on a client system via unspecified vectors.

criterion.comment: CIFS-Development.CIFS-PRG version is less than A.03.02.07
CIFS-Server.CIFS-ADMIN version is less than A.03.02.07
CIFS-Server.CIFS-DOC version is less than A.03.02.07
CIFS-Server.CIFS-LIB version is less than A.03.02.07
CIFS-Server.CIFS-RUN version is less than A.03.02.07
CIFS-Server.CIFS-UTIL version is less than A.03.02.07

metadata.title: HPE HP-UX running CIFS Server (Samba), Remote Denial of Service (DoS), Disclosure of Information, Unauthorized Access
metadata.description: The NTLMSSP authentication implementation in Samba 3.x and 4.x before 4.2.11, 4.3.x before 4.3.8, and 4.4.x before 4.4.2 allows man-in-the-middle attackers to perform protocol-downgrade attacks by modifying the client-server data stream to remove application-layer flags or encryption settings, as demonstrated by clearing the NTLMSSP_NEGOTIATE_SEAL or NTLMSSP_NEGOTIATE_SIGN option to disrupt LDAP security.

criterion.comment: CIFS-Development.CIFS-PRG version is less than A.03.02.07
CIFS-Server.CIFS-ADMIN version is less than A.03.02.07
CIFS-Server.CIFS-DOC version is less than A.03.02.07
CIFS-Server.CIFS-LIB version is less than A.03.02.07
CIFS-Server.CIFS-RUN version is less than A.03.02.07
CIFS-Server.CIFS-UTIL version is less than A.03.02.07

metadata.title: HPE HP-UX running CIFS Server (Samba), Remote Denial of Service (DoS), Disclosure of Information, Unauthorized Access
metadata.description: The bundled LDAP client library in Samba 3.x and 4.x before 4.2.11, 4.3.x before 4.3.8, and 4.4.x before 4.4.2 does not recognize the "client ldap sasl wrapping" setting, which allows man-in-the-middle attackers to perform LDAP protocol-downgrade attacks by modifying the client-server data stream.

criterion.comment: CIFS-Development.CIFS-PRG version is less than A.03.02.07
CIFS-Server.CIFS-ADMIN version is less than A.03.02.07
CIFS-Server.CIFS-DOC version is less than A.03.02.07
CIFS-Server.CIFS-LIB version is less than A.03.02.07
CIFS-Server.CIFS-RUN version is less than A.03.02.07
CIFS-Server.CIFS-UTIL version is less than A.03.02.07

metadata.title: Multiple vulnerabilities in IBM Java SDK affect AIX
metadata.description: An unspecified vulnerability in Oracle Java SE and Java SE Embedded related to the Libraries component has high confidentiality impact, high integrity impact, and high availability impact.

metadata.title: Multiple vulnerabilities in IBM Java SDK affect AIX
metadata.description: An unspecified vulnerability in Oracle Java SE and Java SE Embedded related to the Networking component has no confidentiality impact, low integrity impact, and no availability impact.

metadata.title: Multiple vulnerabilities in IBM Java SDK affect AIX
metadata.description: An unspecified vulnerability in Oracle Java SE related to the Deployment component has high confidentiality impact, high integrity impact, and high availability impact.

metadata.title: Ubuntu 16.10 is installed
metadata.description: Ubuntu 16.10 (Yakkety Yak) is installed

metadata.title: DSA-3684-1 -- libdbd-mysql-perl -- security update
metadata.description: Paul Rohar discovered that libdbd-mysql-perl, the Perl DBI database driver for MySQL and MariaDB, constructed an error message in a fixed-length buffer, leading to a crash (_FORTIFY_SOURCE failure) and, potentially, to denial of service.

metadata.title: DSA-3687-1 -- nspr -- security update
metadata.description: Two vulnerabilities were reported in NSPR, a library to abstract over operating system interfaces developed by the Mozilla project.

metadata.title: DSA-3688-1 -- nss -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities were discovered in NSS, the cryptography library developed by the Mozilla project.

metadata.title: DSA-3683-1 -- chromium-browser -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities have been discovered in the chromium web browser.

metadata.title: DSA-3690-1 -- icedove -- security update
metadata.description: Multiple security issues have been found in Icedove, Debian's version of the Mozilla Thunderbird mail client: Multiple memory safety errors may lead to the execution of arbitrary code or denial of service.

metadata.title: DSA-3682-1 -- c-ares -- security update
metadata.description: Gzob Qq discovered that the query-building functions in c-ares, an asynchronous DNS request library would not correctly process crafted query names, resulting in a heap buffer overflow and potentially leading to arbitrary code execution.

metadata.title: DSA-3685-1 -- libav -- security update
metadata.description: Several security issues have been corrected in multiple demuxers and decoders of the libav multimedia library.

metadata.title: DSA-3693-1 -- libgd2 -- security update
metadata.description: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in the GD Graphics Library, which may result in denial of service or potentially the execution of arbitrary code if a malformed file is processed.

metadata.title: DSA-3689-1 -- php5 -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities were found in PHP, a general-purpose scripting language commonly used for web application development.

metadata.title: DSA-3686-1 -- icedove -- security update
metadata.description: Multiple security issues have been found in Icedove, Debian's version of the Mozilla Thunderbird mail client: Multiple memory safety errors may lead to the execution of arbitrary code or denial of service.

metadata.title: DSA-3692-1 -- freeimage -- security update
metadata.description: Multiple vulnerabilities were discovered in the FreeImage multimedia library, which might result in denial of service or the execution of arbitrary code if a malformed XMP or RAW image is processed.

metadata.title: DSA-3691-1 -- ghostscript -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities were discovered in Ghostscript, the GPL PostScript/PDF interpreter, which may lead to the execution of arbitrary code or information disclosure if a specially crafted Postscript file is processed.

metadata.title: DSA-3703-1 -- bind9 -- security update
metadata.description: Tony Finch and Marco Davids reported an assertion failure in BIND, a DNS server implementation, which causes the server process to terminate. This denial-of-service vulnerability is related to a defect in the processing of responses with DNAME records from authoritative servers and primarily affects recursive resolvers.

metadata.title: DSA-3699-1 -- virtualbox -- end-of-life
metadata.description: Upstream support for the 4.3 release series has ended and since no information is available which would allow backports of isolated security fixes, security support for virtualbox in jessie needed to be ended as well.

criterion.comment: virtualbox is less than or equal 0:4.3.36-dfsg-1+deb8u1

metadata.title: DSA-3701-2 -- nginx -- security update
metadata.description: Dawid Golunski reported the nginx web server packages in Debian suffered from a privilege escalation vulnerability (www-data to root) due to the way log files are handled. This security update changes ownership of the /var/log/nginx directory root. In addition, /var/log/nginx has to be made accessible to local users, and local users may be able to read the log files themselves local until the next logrotate invocation.

metadata.title: DSA-3702-1 -- tar -- security update
metadata.description: Harry Sintonen discovered that GNU tar does not properly handle member names containing '..', thus allowing an attacker to bypass the path names specified on the command line and replace files and directories in the target directory.

metadata.title: DSA-3696-1 -- linux -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities have been discovered in the Linux kernel that may lead to a privilege escalation, denial of service or information leaks.

metadata.title: DSA-3700-1 -- asterisk -- security update
metadata.description: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in Asterisk, an open source PBX and telephony toolkit, which may result in denial of service or incorrect certificate validation.

metadata.title: DSA-3697-1 -- kdepimlibs -- security update
metadata.description: Roland Tapken discovered that insufficient input sanitising in KMail's plain text viewer allowed the injection of HTML code.

metadata.title: DSA-3698-1 -- php5 -- security update
